intro: Aspidium cornu-cervi, commonly known as the horned spleenwort, is a fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen fern that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rock crevices or on tree trunks. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces spore-bearing leaves called sporophylls. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a distinctive, often curled appearance. Aspidium cornu-cervi is characterized by its unique reproductive structures and is often found in temperate regions.
